metadata.title: Our Team
metadata.description: Meet the talented researchers driving innovation in our lab

data.name: Wen Fan
data.description: After earning his MSc from the University of Manchester in 2021, Wen joined the Bristol Robotics Laboratory as a Research Assistant, where he began his hands-on exploration of tactile sensing and robotics in 2022. In 2023, he enrolled in the Engineering Mathematics program at the University of Bristol before transferring to Imperial College London to pursue his doctoral research in Bioengineering. His research focuses on tactile robotics, particularly on advancing the design of vision-based tactile sensors through novel manufacturing techniques.

data.name: Jialin Lin
data.description: Jialin received his MSc degree in Robotics from the University of Bristol in 2022. He obtained his B.E. degree in Mechanical Engineering from Dalian University of Technology in 2021. His main research interest is Magnetic Microrobots for drug delivery.

data.name: Lan Wei
data.description: Lan received her M.E. degree in Computer Science from the University of Science and Technology of China in 2024, after earning her B.E. degree in Computer Science from Xiamen University in 2021. In the same year, she began her doctoral studies in Bioengineering at Imperial College London. Her research focuses on machine learningâ€“based perception for optical microrobots and diffusion-based sim-to-real image generation.

data.name: Zongcai Tan
data.description: Zongcai received his MRes degree in Medical Robotics and Image Guided Intervention from Imperial College London in 2024. He obtained his B.E. degree in Vehicle Engineering from Jilin University in 2022. His main research interest is machine learning based design and control of optical microrobots.

data.name: Nitirak Rayabphand (Co-Supervise)
data.description: Nitirak received his Master degree in Robotics Engineering from Osaka University in 2022. He earned his B.E. degree in Mechatronic Engineering from King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi in 2015. His research focuses on magnetic microscale robotics for medical application. He is a PhD student of the University of Bristol under supervision of Professor Sabine Hauert (main supervisor) and Assistant Professor Dandan Zhang (second supervisor).

data.name: Qingzheng Cong
data.description: Qingzheng received his MSc degree in Biorobotics from the University of Bristol in 2023 and his B.E. degree in Mechanical Engineering from Durham University in 2022. His main research interests include tactile perception, haptic feedback, and soft robotic manipulation.

data.name: Ziyuan Dong
data.description: Ziyuan is currently working toward the Ph.D. degree in Electronic and Information Engineering at the College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology. His research interests include data-driven control, robot-physical systems, and fault diagnosis.
